artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi; Carver: Katada Chōjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 289.13; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; two men fighting; man at left wears red garment with purple lining, green pants with purple floral designs, purple sleeves with black patterning and black boots, and holds the hair of the man at right in his PL hand; man at right wearing yellow kimono, white pants and straw sandals and holds the PL wrist of other man in his PL hand, and holds other man's hair in his PR hand
inscription: 東南は平地に接し西北は高阜に対す天神台に大砲を備へ左京ハ此場の隊長なりしが午前の攻撃大利を得しも本営に焔々たる火の手上り戦揆変じて敗北するにのぞみ再び山内に引退き敵にも名ある丈夫と引組んで刺違へし勇膽尤も賞すに足れり　応需転々堂鈍々記
markings: Artist’s seal: 月岡 {Tsukioka} | Carver’s seal: 片田彫長 {Katada hori Chō} | Censor seal: 戌二
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Biographies of Valiant Drunken Tigers (Keisei suikoden 競勢酔虎傳
title: Sumoto Sakyō
